name: content
title: NodeJS Brief
content: Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform JavaScript runtime environment for developing a diverse variety of tools and applications.Although Node.js is not a JavaScript framework, many of its basic modules are written in JavaScript, and developers can write new modules in JavaScript. The runtime environment interprets JavaScript using Google's V8 JavaScript engine.
Node.js was originally written in 2009 by Ryan Dahl. The initial release supported only Linux. Its development and maintenance was led by Dahl and later sponsored by Joyent.
